english.segment1: It's hard to take the blame but sometimes credit's due. It's easier to rearrange what's wrong from what is true. The focus is not on you, what part could I have had?. I'm sorry if I messed things up, I wasn't meaning to
english.segment2: And I realize now, it doesn't matter how. I'm responsible for my actions. And yours are up to you
english.segment3: And I realize now, I can't be the judge. If I only see the wrong you've done. Then the wrong should be on me
english.segment4: The circumstantial disagreements that we face. Are better when the truth about them doesn't get misplaced. My senseless rational kicks in and takes control. The words I spoke are said and done, they're meaningless the same
